column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Chișinău

#Text=Chişinău ( Russian Kishinyov , Ukrainian Kishiniv , pronounced " Kishinau " with " nau " as in the English word " know " ) is the capital of Moldova with a population of around 790,000 plus 250,000 people coming each day for work and entertainment from all over the country and abroad .
#Text=The city 's territory with nearest suburbs cover the area of 635 km .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Chişinău is very wealthy compared to the rest of the country , as Moldova is not a very rich country , and the countryside especially is poor .
#Text=As is common in developing countries , you are likely to see great disparities in wealth .
#Text=It 's also very much a post-Soviet city , with both the good and bad qualities associated with it .
#Text=By other side you 'll see many modern and great buildings of steel , concrete and glass .
#Text=The majority of the middle and working class population lives in blocks of flats .
#Text=These look standard , maybe not too nice but are not " dangerous " as similar areas may be considered to be in Western Europe .
#Text=Do not expect Western standards everywhere , but the situation is improving every year .
#Text=There are 4- and 5-star hotels , good restaurants and cafes , coffee houses and bars .
#Text=Many restaurants and almost all the hotels in the city accept the credit cards .
#Text=There are hundreds of ATMs throughout the city .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Chişinău International Airport ( KIV ) .

#Text=Served by many airlines like AirBaltic , Air Moldova , Austrian , Lufthansa , Moldavian Airlines , Tarom , Turkish Airlines , S7 Aircompany , Wizz Air with flights around the Europe and Asia , notably to Athens , Bucharest , Budapest , Frankfurt , Istanbul , Madrid , Milan- Bergamo , Moscow , Munich , Riga , Rome , Timisoara , Vienna , Vilnius , Saint Petersburg , Varna , Paris , London , Bologna and Surgut .
#Text=N. 165 takes you through Botanica to the center , Izmail street .
#Text=Tickets cost 3 lei ; luggage will cost you another ticket .
#Text=The minibuses are white vans leaving from the airport parking lot .
#Text=If you leave the airport building from the arrivals area , turn right and walk towards the end of the building .
#Text=The buses are marked with the number 165 on a sign behind the windshield and you can flag one down passing you , or walk up to the ones still parking .
#Text=Do n't open the sliding door even though you have luggage ; for some reason they always use the co-drivers door to get on and off .
#Text=N. 30 leaves just out of the arrivals door and is marked by a sign with the times .
#Text=Pay the girl with an apron 2 lei ( July 2018 )
#Text=once the bus is running .
#Text=It takes you to Botanical Gardens , Ismail Street and Bulevardul Stefan cel Mare si Sfint ( main street ) .
#Text=By train
#Text=See Calea Ferata Moldova ( CFM ) - Moldovan Railways .
#Text=There is one Central Railway Station and a few suburban stations at the city 's ends .
#Text=The trains depart to Europe through Romania and to the Community of Independent States , especially to Russia , Ukraine and Belarus .
#Text=From Western Europe , the train is much cheaper than a flight .
#Text=The downside is that they are slow , particularly when crossing the borders into the former Soviet Union , where they need to stop to have their wheels changed due to different rail gauge .
#Text=The most popular route is from Bucharest , daily overnight trains leave Gara de Nord station at 19:15 and arrive at 09:30 .
#Text=The ' couchette ' - shared sleeper cabin , cost approximately 136 Romanian lei purchased the day of in Bucharest .
#Text=Another useful route is from Warsaw , departing every second day taking two nights ( 38 hr ) .
#Text=Chişinău is served by three routes from Russia , one from Moscow via Kiev , one from Saint Petersburg and one from Rostov-on-Don .
#Text=Several cities in Ukraine also have daily connections .
#Text=A direct train from Odessa leaves Odessa at 16:00 and arrives at ~22:00 the same evening , running only on Saturdays and Sundays .
#Text=This train crosses the unrecognised breakaway state of Transnistria and makes a quick stop-over in its capital , Tiraspol .
#Text=A single journey costs 244 грн as of May 2015 .
#Text=By car
#Text=Roads in Moldova are quite bad .
#Text=The road leading from Chişinău to Leuseni is pretty nice .
#Text=You are likely to be sharing the road with trucks , cars , and livestock , all moving at various speeds without a lot of regard for safety .

#Text=Because the driving and quality of the roads in Moldova is different from what a Westerner would probably be used to , it is thus better to rely on public transport , which is very cheap and ( mostly ) reliable .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Chişinău has three bus stations :
#Text=Gara Centrală ( Autogara Chișinău Centru ) , Strada Mitropolitul Varlaam 58 , ☏ +37322542185 .
#Text=Serving mainly in-country destinations including Transnistria .
#Text=Buy your ticket at the Kassa .
#Text=Tickets for international trips have to be bought inside the bus station instead of directly from the driver .
#Text=Gara de Nord ( Chisinau North Bus Station ) , Strada Calea Moșilor 2/1 .
#Text=For in-country destinations on the northern part of the country like Sorocca , Rezina , Ocnita , for travel to Odessa , Kyiv and elsewhere in Ukraine .
#Text=Gara de Sud ( Южный автовокзал ) , ☏ +37322723983 .
#Text=For in-country destinations in the southern part of the country like Comrat , Cahul and for journeys to Romania .
#Text=Getting there/away : from central Chişinău on rutiera ( microbus ) number 120 , 124 , 180 or 192 for 3 lei .
#Text=Gara Nord is served by rutiera 163 and trolleybus #9 , along with a bunch of others .
#Text=You can check bus timetables ( for in-country , and international destinations ) at this website .
#Text=From specific destinations :
#Text=Transnistria – From Tiraspol ( leaving from the train/bus station : gara ) and Bendery there are semi-hourly marshrutkas taking 90 min and 40 rubles .
#Text=You can also pay in Moldavan lei , about 37 lei .
#Text=Bucharest –
#Text=Many companies operate ' rutieras ' during the day and larger coaches during the night heading to Bucharest .
#Text=The journey is 8-9 hr journey with hourly departures in the evening .
#Text=There often is no toilet on the bus but several stops were made by the bus driver .
#Text=Most companies run to/from the central bus station behind the Central Market .
#Text=Iași – Coach services are operated to/from Gara de Sud .
#Text=There are nine services a day .
#Text=The trip takes around 3½ – 5 hr .
#Text=Odessa –
#Text=The journey from Odessa takes around 5 hr and costs around US$ 10 .
#Text=Most buses from Odessa go through southern Moldova , avoiding the Transnistrian region — these will be marked as going through Palanka or Causeni .
#Text=There are also several buses throughout the day from Chernivtsi , and Lviv .
